newsitem.title: USA: Sperling says balanced budget key to U.S. economy.
newsitem.headline: Sperling says balanced budget key to U.S. economy.

text.p: A top economic adviser to President Clinton said Wednesday a balanced budget agreement this year is central to keeping the U.S. economy on track.
Gene Sperling, chairman of the White House National Economic Council, declined comment on Fed Chairman Alan Greenspan's concerns about rising stock prices and the risk of inflation.

"We do think the single most important thing to keep long-term interest rates low, investment high and to keep this sound expansion going is to have a balanced budget agreement this year," Sperling told reporters.

"That means a real agreement where you lock in the tough choices and we're seen as credible. Doing that is the single most important thing we can do to help the economy and that's why having a balanced budget agreement that also promotes education for long-term growth is our number one priority," he said.
